08egiRxOvMX97XTc.description:
The werecreature changes into its humanoid, hybrid, or animal shape. Each shape has a specific, persistent appearance. A true werecreature's natural form is its hybrid shape.

In humanoid shape, the werecreature uses its original humanoid size, loses its jaws and claws Strikes, and gains a melee fist Strike that deals bludgeoning damage equal to the slashing damage dealt by its claw.

In animal shape, its Speed and size change to that of the animal, it gains any special Strike effects of the animal that it didn't already have (such as Grab), and it loses its weapon Strikes.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
08egiRxOvMX97XTc.name: (Werecreature) Change Shape

0B9eEetIbeSPhulD.description: The divine warden selects two of its patron deity's domains. The divine warden can cast the basic domain spell for its chosen domains. The divine warden has a focus pool of 1 Focus Point. It can't Refocus, but its focus pool automatically refills 24 hours after it last used a Focus Point. If the divine warden is at least 10th level, it also gains the advanced domain spells for its chosen domains, and its focus pool increases to 2 Focus Points.
0B9eEetIbeSPhulD.name: (Divine Warden) Divine Domain Spells

0K3vhX14UEPftqu8.description: The ghost cries out in pain and anguish as small objects and debris fly about in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. Creatures in this area take [[/r {1d6}[bludgeoning]]]{1d6 bludgeoning damage} + 1d6 per 2 levels, subject to a @Check[type:reflex|dc:|basic:true] save.
0K3vhX14UEPftqu8.name: (Ghost) Telekinetic Assault

49aAeGbH5p2IJ5Fz.description: Kuworsys's sling becomes a reload 0 weapon instead of reload 1.
49aAeGbH5p2IJ5Fz.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
49aAeGbH5p2IJ5Fz.name: (Kuworsys) Rapid Bombadment

4Aj4FWKObfMYoSvh.description:
Requirements A creature the ghost is aware of targets the ghost with an attack

Effect The ghost has an unusually pitiable appearance or can change its features to look like someone close to the attacker, which causes the target to pull back on its attack.

The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:] save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 circumstance penalty to its attack roll (-2 on a critical failure).
4Aj4FWKObfMYoSvh.name: (Ghost) Beatific Appearance

4UEZY3G3CiCP78Kx.description: The visitant makes a claw Strike against a creature it has @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. If the attack hits, that creature is knocked @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.
4UEZY3G3CiCP78Kx.source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God
4UEZY3G3CiCP78Kx.name: (Visitant) Wrestle

4p06ewIsPnWZwuwc.description:
The ghost extends some of its nature to one or more undead of equal or lower level, who are connected to the ghost's story and unfinished business.

These undead gain the ghost's @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]{Rejuvenation} ability and can't be permanently destroyed so long as the ghost exists. If the ghost is laid to rest, all linked undead are likewise instantly destroyed.

Linked undead often, but not always, share the ghost's @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]{Site Bound} ability as well. The ghost doesn't have any control over such undead, and indeed the ghost and their partners in eternity may be unremittingly hostile to one another.
4p06ewIsPnWZwuwc.name: (Ghost) Lynchpin

5DuBTf37u88IrphJ.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/br 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.efFe4EK7ThUrH446]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.
5DuBTf37u88IrphJ.name: (Vampire, Basic) Vampire Weaknesses

5arYoSY5kcRo8TeM.description:
Vrykolakas all have the following vulnerabilities.

  • Burial Site Bound A vrykolakas is bound to the place of its death or interment. It must return to this location once per week and bury itself in the earth for 24 hours, during which time it is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} and can be beheaded. If it is unable to return to this site, it is reduced to 0 Hit Points and attempts to use Feral Corruption; if this host animal can't return to the burial site before the possession effect ends, the vrykolakas is destroyed and the animal host returns to normal.
  • Vulnerable to Decapitation A vrykolakas that is beheaded can't use its Feral Possession, and a beheaded corpse cannot rise as a vrykolakas.
5arYoSY5kcRo8TeM.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas) Vrykolakas Vulnerabilities

5dbzWZbiTyPKgwKS.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, the creature's Speed is reduced by 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]{Effect: Graveknight's Curse}
5dbzWZbiTyPKgwKS.name: (Graveknight) Graveknight's Curse

5lv9r2ubDCov4dFn.description:
The ghost causes great gouts of flame to erupt without warning.

The ghost picks three 5-foot squares within 30 feet. Creatures that start in or enter one of these squares take [[/r {1d6}[fire]]]{1d6 fire damage} per 2 levels the ghost has, subject to a @Check[type:reflex|dc:|basic:true] save.

The flames last for 1 minute and don't set other things alight unless the ghost wishes. If the ghost uses this ability again, it dismisses any existing flames.
5lv9r2ubDCov4dFn.name: (Ghost) Pyre's Memory

6Alm4mLj3ORxCXC2.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:0]{0 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura} @Check[type:will|dc:|name:Cowering Fear]

A ravener's frightful presence causes creatures to cower in fear as well. As long as a creature is at least @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} or more as a result of the ravener's frightful presence, it is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} from the fear.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]
6Alm4mLj3ORxCXC2.name: (Ravener) Cowering Fear

6isn9nqnvfRrC1wW.description:
The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

As NPC strikes are not generated from the weapons it holds, this feature cannot be automated. Add a "Note" rule element to each of the graveknight's strikes for the correct critical specialization. An example is provided.
6isn9nqnvfRrC1wW.name: (Graveknight) Weapon Master

7jWANvnDmNcQvFve.description:
At the time of its creation, a graveknight chooses one of the following energy types that was relevant to its life or death: acid, cold, electricity, or fire.

Any weapon the graveknight wields gains the effects of the caustic, frost, shock, or flaming weapon rune, respectively, in addition to a +1 striking weapon rune.

If the graveknight is 14th level or higher, its weapons instead gain the effects of the greater versions of both of these runes.
7jWANvnDmNcQvFve.name: (Graveknight) Ruinous Weapons

871jo3ZGnybF6dC8.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The lich is accompanied by a constant echo of blasphemous murmurs and tainted whispers.

A creature in the aura takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against mental effects and can't take actions that have the concentrate trait unless they succeed at a @Check[type:flat|dc:10] check. Failing this check wastes the action.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.jrfuplUEq3PIo6j1]{Effect: Blasphemous Utterances}
871jo3ZGnybF6dC8.name: (Lich) Blasphemous Utterances

98twzz56mMGN5Ftw.description:
Requirements The vrykolakas' last action was a successful fangs Strike

Effect The vrykolakas sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC. On a success, the creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} if a vrykolakas master uses this action), and the vrykolakas regains HP equal to 10% of its maximum HP, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire, but it increases the creature's drained condition value by 1. A vrykolakas can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

The target creature's drained condition value decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a successful @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drained value by 1 after 10 minutes.
98twzz56mMGN5Ftw.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas) Drink Blood

9oy2zWxy7Klk9FxR.description:
The skeleton is wreathed with fire, which doesn't consume its bones or gear.

The skeleton gains immunity to fire and weakness 5 to cold, loses its resistance to cold, and its Strikes deal additional persistent fire damage equal to half the skeleton's level (minimum 1 damage).
9oy2zWxy7Klk9FxR.name: (Skeleton) Blaze

9wX6EFimVFYFZjD7.description: Beneath the plates of bone and ice on Ulgrem-Axaan flow the viscous remains of its vital fluids. Creatures coming into physical contact with this fluid must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22|name:Ichor Coating] save or become infected with @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.N7UV5CZXtcoxDxCF]{Ghoul Fever}.
9wX6EFimVFYFZjD7.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
9wX6EFimVFYFZjD7.name: (Ulgrem-Axaan) Ichor Coating

AjTkksppymqzCivT.description:
The vampire can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.
AjTkksppymqzCivT.name: (Vampire, True) Dominate

AydIHjDNbOZizj5U.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5|damaging:yes]{5 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The air within 5 feet of the ghost is supernaturally cold. Characters that enter or begin their turn in the ghost's aura take [[/r {1d6}[cold]]]{1d6 cold damage} per 3 levels the ghost has (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:|basic:true] save).
AydIHjDNbOZizj5U.name: (Ghost) Cold Spot

BSLqIYqxcCVBb2Vp.description:
This zombie is nigh unkillable. The zombie loses its weakness to slashing and gains resistance against all damage equal to its level (minimum 3), and it gains weakness equal to twice its level (minimum 6) to critical hits.

Increase the zombie's level by 1 if you give it this ability.
BSLqIYqxcCVBb2Vp.name: (Zombie) Unkillable

BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV.description: A typical ghost can stray only a short distance from where it was killed or the place it haunts. A typical limit is 120 feet. Some ghosts are instead bound to a room, building, item, or creature that was special to it rather than a location.
BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV.name: (Ghost) Site Bound

BgbSHRdkGH7raOgA.description:
HP __; AC __, Fort +__, Ref +__, Will +__

The graveknight summons a supernatural mount as per @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Phantom Steed}, heightened to a level equal to half the graveknight's level.

Unlike phantom steed, the steed's AC and saving throw bonuses are all 4 lower than the graveknight's, and the steed has one-third the graveknight's Hit Points (rounded down).

If the steed is destroyed, the graveknight must wait 1 hour before using this ability again.
BgbSHRdkGH7raOgA.name: (Graveknight) Phantom Mount

CxiEpXt7Gw3tSIOh.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour.

Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} as its wounds fester. This damage increases by 1d6 for every 6 levels the zombie has.

Creatures that take a critical hit from the zombie also take this damage immediately.
CxiEpXt7Gw3tSIOh.name: (Zombie) Rotting Aura

DlHTe9jLssEELY6a.description: A divine warden whose patron deity has any alignment components gains @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qwZBXN6zBoB9BHXE]{Divine Lance} as an innate cantrip. A divine warden with a neutral patron deity instead gains @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{Daze} as an innate cantrip.
DlHTe9jLssEELY6a.name: (Divine Warden) Divine Innate Spells

EM6YZCt6vFCFhXmb.description:
Trigger A goblin ally ends a move action adjacent to the goblin.

Effect The goblin @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Steps}.
EM6YZCt6vFCFhXmb.name: (Goblin) Goblin Scuttle

FA0ri2fAcMa1HgZe.description:
When a full moon appears in the night sky, the werecreature must enter hybrid form, can't Change Shape thereafter, becomes one size larger, increases its reach by 5 feet, and increases the damage of its jaws Strike (or a similar Strike) by 2.

When the moon sets or the sun rises, the werecreature returns to humanoid form and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for [[/br 2d4 #Fatigued duration]]{2d4 hours}.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.dRe8n1nBWMIXd8jh]{Effect: Moon Frenzy}
FA0ri2fAcMa1HgZe.name: (Werecreature) Moon Frenzy

FW4KAUHb7r8WkxUc.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by a ghoul's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.
FW4KAUHb7r8WkxUc.name: (Ghoul) Paralysis

FXHjmH1oce7Z3tZb.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} begins to function normally.
FXHjmH1oce7Z3tZb.name: (Vampire, Basic) Coffin Restoration

FsqVhavMWAoFro1L.description:
An intangible field of necromantic energy protects a ravener from total destruction. A soul ward has 150 maximum Hit Points, or 200 if the ravener is level 21 or higher.

Whenever a ravener would be reduced below 1 Hit Point, all damage in excess of what would reduce them to 1 Hit Point is instead dealt to their soul ward. If this damage reduces the soul ward to fewer than 0 Hit Points, the ravener is destroyed.

A soul ward's Hit Points can be restored only via specific ravener abilities such as Consume Soul, ravenous breath, or vicious criticals. A ravener who goes more than a week without successfully using Consume Soul to feed on a dying creature starves, and their soul ward loses [[/r {1d4} #Soul Ward Decay]]{1d4 Hit Points} each day until they feed. If the ravener's soul ward loses all its Hit Points while the ravener still has more than 1 HP, they become a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Yv0005Vym1peVKHq]{Ravener Husk}.
FsqVhavMWAoFro1L.name: (Ravener) Soul Ward

G4yIjHMzD0KVpaCm.description: The Melfesh Monster Burrows twice. At any point in this movement, it can shed a temporary fungal limb to grasp a creature within 10 feet. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|name:Burrowing Grasp] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} for 1 round (on a critical failure, 2 rounds) or until it Escapes (DC 21). This ability grants the Melfesh Monster a burrow speed of 15 feet and replaces its fly speed and Envelop.
G4yIjHMzD0KVpaCm.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
G4yIjHMzD0KVpaCm.name: (Melfish Monster) Burrowing Grasp

HKFoOZZV4WdjkeeJ.description:
Many proteans can subject their foes to disorienting alterations perceived in time and space by creating ripples of unstable reality in the environment called warpwaves. When a creature fails its saving throw and is affected by a warpwave, roll [[/br 1d8 #Warpwave]]{1d8} and consult the table below for the specific effect on that creature. Unless indicated otherwise, a warpwave effect lasts for [[/br 1d4 #Duration Warpwave Effect]]{1d4 rounds}, and a new warpwave effect negates any previous warpwave effect already affecting a creature.

[[/br 1d8 #Warpwave]]{1d8} Warpwave Effect
1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} on a critical failure)
2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and gains [[/r 4d6 #Temporary Hit Points]]{4d6 temporary Hit Points}
3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (permanent on a critical failure)
4 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3} on a critical failure)
5 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} by filaments of energy
6 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} (Stride, Strike, or Step only)
7 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}
8 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} on a critical failure)
HKFoOZZV4WdjkeeJ.name: (Protean) Warpwave

HLPLYJ9bOazb2ZPX.description:
Trigger The ravener takes excess damage to their soul ward but still has at least 51 Hit Points in their soul ward

Effect The ravener draws deeply into their soul ward, discorporating their body into soul energy in order to escape. They take 50 damage to their soul ward and their physical body vanishes, reappearing [[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours} later in a random location within 1 mile from the location where they used Discorporate.
HLPLYJ9bOazb2ZPX.name: (Ravener) Discorporate

HdSaMUb4uEsbtQTn.description:
Thick briars have grown through the skeleton's bones, covering it in red roses with inch-long thorns.

The skeleton's unarmed melee Strikes deal additional piercing damage equal to 1/3 the skeleton's level (minimum 1 damage).

At the end of each of its turns, if the skeleton has caused piercing damage with its thorns, it regains HP equal to its level (minimum 1). Each time the skeleton regains HP in this way, another rose blossoms.
HdSaMUb4uEsbtQTn.name: (Skeleton) Skeleton of Roses

ICnpftxZEilrYjn0.description:
This curse affects only humanoids.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Curse of the Werecreature] DC is the standard DC for the werecreature's new level -1.

On each full moon, the cursed creature must succeed at another Fortitude save or turn into the same kind of werecreature until dawn.

The creature is under the GM's control and goes on a rampage for half the night before falling unconscious until dawn.
ICnpftxZEilrYjn0.name: (Werecreature) Curse of the Werecreature

IFQd4GiHlV33p7oK.description:
A nymph queen can inspire a single intelligent creature by giving that creature a token of her favor, typically a lock of her hair. As long as the creature carries her token and remains in good standing with the nymph queen, the creature gains a +1 status bonus to all Crafting checks, Performance checks, and Will saves.

If a nymph queen grants her Inspiration to a bard and the nymph queen is that bard's muse, the bard gains an additional benefit depending on their muse theme: for lore muse, the bard also gains a +1 status bonus to all Lore checks; for maestro muse, the status bonus to Performance checks increases to +2 for the purpose of determining the effects of compositions; for polymath muse, the bard gains a +4 status bonus to untrained skill checks; and for all other muses, the Will save bonus increases to +2 against fey.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.iSyyR4QVOaY6mxtg]{Effect: Nymph Queen's Inspiration}
IFQd4GiHlV33p7oK.name: (Nymph Queen) Inspiration

IOk0MRs3f9FrarKL.description:
A protean's vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the protean takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage of one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first. The protean is immune to polymorph effects unless it is a willing target. If @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened}, the protean automatically recovers at the end of its next turn as new sensory organs grow to replace the compromised ones.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.c6SiBB3mzV8lZUQr]{Effect: Protean Anatomy}
IOk0MRs3f9FrarKL.name: (Protean) Protean Anatomy

IxJbFJ8dG5RbZWBD.description:
The graveknight unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of energy. Creatures in the area take [[/r {1d12}[damageType]]]{1d12 damageType damage}, plus an additional 1d12 damage for every two levels the graveknight has (@Check[type:reflex|dc:|basic:true] save).

The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

This energy damage is of the same type as that of its ruinous weapons; Devastating Blast gains the associated energy trait.
IxJbFJ8dG5RbZWBD.name: (Graveknight) Devastating Blast

JSBmboE6bYVxDT9d.description:
The ghost possesses an object of size Large or smaller within 20 feet, making it an animated object. This animated object's level can be no higher than the ghost's level -2. If the target object is being held by a creature, the bearer can attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:] save to prevent the possession.

This possession ends when the object is destroyed or the ghost leaves it. At this point, the ghost reappears in the object's square and can't Inhabit an Object again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]](1d4 rounds}.
JSBmboE6bYVxDT9d.name: (Ghost) Inhabit Object

K5bNE90vmeFzktnM.description:
Trigger The skeleton is critically hit.

Effect The skeleton collapses into a pile of bones and the attack deals only normal damage. The skeleton can reform in a standing position as an action, but until it does, it is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed}.
K5bNE90vmeFzktnM.name: (Skeleton) Collapse

KJrQdJQ0ZEmKYH4Y.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20] @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

While the Kallas Devil is disguised as a child, any creature in the aura who is considered an adult by their culture takes a -2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs opposing the Kallas Devil's Deception.
KJrQdJQ0ZEmKYH4Y.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
KJrQdJQ0ZEmKYH4Y.name: (Kallas Devil) Suffer the Children

KcUHCVhHnkMD8j3k.description:
The barghest breathes a cloud of toxic gas that deals [[/r {8d6}[poison]]]{8d6 poison damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:25|basic:true] save).

It can't use Toxic Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Toxic Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.
KcUHCVhHnkMD8j3k.name: (Greater Barghest) Mutation - Toxic Breath

KwmYKsaXHKfZgB2c.description:
Trigger Spring-Heeled Jack uses Vault

Effect Spring-Heeled Jack becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} for 1 round.
KwmYKsaXHKfZgB2c.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
KwmYKsaXHKfZgB2c.name: (Spring-Heeled Jack) Vanishing Leap

L80gn6WOWi9roJW3.description: The divine warden is a beacon for its deity's faith. A cleric of the divine warden's patron deity can channel a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell through a divine warden they can see within 60 feet. The cleric determines any targets or area for the spell as if they were standing in the divine warden's space.
L80gn6WOWi9roJW3.name: (Divine Warden) Instrument of Faith

LOd8QwaKP3hnyGkc.description: While the Kallas Devil is in water, she gains cold resistance 10 and electricity weakness 5.
LOd8QwaKP3hnyGkc.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
LOd8QwaKP3hnyGkc.name: (Kallas Devil) Cold Currents

MAC97gjFcdiqLyhp.description:
The skeleton removes its skull and throws it, making a jaws attack with a range of 20 feet. It then attempts to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} each foe within 10 feet of the target.

The head bounces, rolls, or even flies back, returning to the skeleton at the start of its next turn. The skeleton is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until then.
MAC97gjFcdiqLyhp.name: (Skeleton) Screaming Skull

MhymIeTQoxbacG1o.description:
The zombie carries a plague that can create more of its own kind.

This functions as the @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.KxN9aGFGPxl6oLGF]{Plague Zombie's} zombie rot, except at stage 5, the victim rises as another of the zombie's type, rather than a plague zombie.

Zombie Rot

An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Zombie Rot]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} (1 day)

Stage 3 [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} (1 day)

Stage 5 dead, rising as another of the zombie's type immediately
MhymIeTQoxbacG1o.name: (Zombie) Plague-Ridden

N7UV5CZXtcoxDxCF.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {2d6}[negative]]]{2d6 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.
N7UV5CZXtcoxDxCF.name: (Ghoul) Ghoul Fever

NSO2l1jXK32oTnVP.description: When winter comes to Riverton, the Kallas Devil sharpens her claws with chunks of ice. When the Kallas Devil makes a jaws or claw attack, she deals an additional [[/r {1d6}[cold]]]{1d6 cold damage}.
NSO2l1jXK32oTnVP.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
NSO2l1jXK32oTnVP.name: (Kallas Devil)  Freezing Touch

Nnl5wg6smOzieTop.description:
The vampire turns into a cloud of vapor, as the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.V8wXOsoejQhe6CyG]{Gaseous Form} spell, or back to its normal form. The vampire loses @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} while in gaseous form.

The vampire can remain in this form indefinitely.
Nnl5wg6smOzieTop.name: (Vampire, True) Turn to Mist

OD3VPUalSKDTYFmF.description: The barghest has malformed wings extending from its back. It gains a fly Speed of 25 feet.
OD3VPUalSKDTYFmF.name: (Greater Barghest) Mutation - Wings

OMSsLUcnRj6ycEUa.description:
The graveknight redirects magical energies through its armor, allowing it to deliver magic through an attack.

The graveknight Casts a Spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll. The effects of the spell don't occur immediately but are imbued into an attack instead. The graveknight then makes a melee Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack. The spell is coupled with the attack, using the attack roll result to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell.

This counts as two attacks for the graveknight's multiple attack penalty but doesn't apply the penalty until after it's completed Channeling Magic.

The graveknight can't use Channel Magic again for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.
OMSsLUcnRj6ycEUa.name: (Graveknight) Channel Magic

OPGu0WsUHpHSmu80.description: A divine warden can't attack a creature that openly wears or displays the religious symbol of the divine warden's patron deity unless that creature uses a hostile action against the divine warden first. If the divine warden is intelligent, it can also attack a creature it believes isn't faithful to its deity or who wears the religious symbol as a ruse (typically after succeeding at a Perception check to Sense Motive).
OPGu0WsUHpHSmu80.name: (Divine Warden) Faith Bound

P5YTG6I8ci4lwhZ1.description: The skeleton is covered in dripping blood and gains @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{Fast Healing} equal to its level.
P5YTG6I8ci4lwhZ1.name: (Skeleton) Bloody

PjYwPIUUrirQFiee.description: While underwater, the Kallas Devil can blend in with the surrounding environment and hide from other creatures by attempting a Stealth check. She has a +4 circumstance bonus for this check.
PjYwPIUUrirQFiee.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
PjYwPIUUrirQFiee.name: (Kallas Devil) Underwater Views

QMWvYf8Qowj2Fzmx.description: The graveknight has positive resistance equal to its level.
QMWvYf8Qowj2Fzmx.name: (Graveknight) Dark Deliverance

QlrbnkeZu6M4kvOy.description:
When the worm that walks is reduced to 0 HP, it discorporates and the component worms that make up its body disperse in every direction. If even a single worm escapes, the worm that walks will eventually re-form using a process that typically takes [[/r 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}.

While the exact circumstances and surroundings determine how long the worm that walks's foes have to dispatch the fleeing worms before they escape, usually its foes have only a single round.

Typically, this requires the application of an area effect or splash weapon within 1 round to the space where the worm that walks collapsed. After any amount of area or splash damage is dealt to that space, the character dealing the damage must attempt a @Check[type:flat|dc:15|showDC:owner] check. Each subsequent area or splash damage effect performed on the area reduces the DC of this flat check by 2, to a minimum of DC 5. If any of these flat checks succeed, none of the worms escape, and the worm that walks is destroyed permanently.

At the GM's discretion, clever means of trapping or otherwise detaining the vermin may extend the time allowed to finish off the worm that walks.
QlrbnkeZu6M4kvOy.name: (Worm That Walks) Discorporate

QuHeuVNDnmOCS9M1.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, a vrykolakas master can turn this creature into a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.8IyfadYYpYXBvlXN]{Vrykolakas Spawn} by donating some of its own blood to the creature and burying it in earth for 3 nights.

Such vrykolakas spawn are generally friendly to the vrykolakas that created them, but they are not under its control and typically wander off on their own rampage within [[/r 1d6 #days]]{1d6 days} of their creation.
QuHeuVNDnmOCS9M1.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Create Spawn

RQ9NaIerG95wkhjl.description:
Requirements A creature in Ulgrem-Axaan's reach is prone, and Ulgrem-Axaan isn't currently grabbing another creature;

Effect Ulgrem-Axaan attempts a jaws Strike against the creature. If successful, Ulgrem-Axaan immediately @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabs} the creature, and the creature takes an additional [[/r {2d10}[bludgeoning]]]{2d10 bludgeoning} damage.
RQ9NaIerG95wkhjl.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
RQ9NaIerG95wkhjl.name: (Ulgrem-Axaan) Fallen Victim

RgYpzTk3XapgVeXZ.description:
The skeleton yanks a rib from its ribcage to use as an arrow or javelin. The skeleton loses HP equal to its level (minimum 1), then makes a ranged Strike.

This uses the attack bonus of whichever of the skeleton's other Strikes has the highest attack bonus and deals piercing damage equal to that Strike's damage plus the skeleton's level (minimum 1).
RgYpzTk3XapgVeXZ.name: (Skeleton) Bone Missile

RvzFTym3r22VhMrm.description: Kuworsys Strides up to twice its Speed. At the end of its movement, it can make a melee limb Strike. On a successful Strike, the creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until the end of Kuworsys's next turn
RvzFTym3r22VhMrm.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
RvzFTym3r22VhMrm.name: (Kuworsys) Smash and Grab

SEmSk1INZDmeoB5R.description: The nymph queen focuses her beauty upon a target within her aura. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:0] save. On a failure, it is affected as if by the nymph queen's nymph's beauty aura; if it was already affected by the aura, it suffers a greater effect described in the nymph queen's entry. A nymph queen can Focus Beauty on a given creature only once per turn.
SEmSk1INZDmeoB5R.name: (Nymph Queen) Focus Beauty

SEzkqVJxr2eJDsuJ.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} as long as it's sickened on a critical failure).

While within the aura, the creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.wX9L6fbqVMLP05hn]{Effect: Stench}
SEzkqVJxr2eJDsuJ.name: (Ghast) Stench

UHuA1hue5xrRM6KK.description: A nymph queen is intrinsically tied to a specific region, such as a forest for a dryad queen. As long as the queen is healthy, the environment is exceptionally resilient, allowing the nymph queen to automatically attempt to counteract spells and rituals such as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.7yWXx3qC4eFNHhxD]{Blight} that would harm the environment, using her Spell DC with a counteract level equal to the highest-level druid spell she can cast. When the nymph queen becomes physically or psychologically unhealthy, however, her warded region eventually becomes twisted or unhealthy as well. In that case, restoring the nymph queen swiftly heals the entire region.
UHuA1hue5xrRM6KK.name: (Nymph Queen) Tied to the Land

UOqq8lkBPcPtKoCN.description: The Melfesh Monster sprays flaming gas in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] or a @Template[type:line|distance:30]. Creatures in the area take [[/r {4d6}[fire]]]{4d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true|name:Flame Lash] save). This ability replaces the firelance ranged Strike.
UOqq8lkBPcPtKoCN.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
UOqq8lkBPcPtKoCN.name: (Melfish Monster) Flame Lash

UU1Fp3PRuTFONjC9.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.
UU1Fp3PRuTFONjC9.name: (Ghoul) Swift Leap

UlKGxPaKtRGWuq3V.description: A divine warden always wields its patron deity's favored weapon. If the weapon is a ranged weapon, the divine warden automatically generates new ammunition with each attack. For a divine warden of 4th level or higher, the deity's favored weapon gains the effects of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.DxCuJKynlnMQZHgp]{Striking} rune while the divine warden wields it; at 12th level, these effects are of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.KCQRFvUgbyclvOGi]{Greater Striking} rune, and at 19th level, they're instead of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.woxl2FrrgAcJDu0t]{Major Striking} rune.
UlKGxPaKtRGWuq3V.name: (Divine Warden) Faithful Weapon

VLCECgjkL5bNOxpx.description:
Trigger A living creature within 30 feet of the ravener dies

Effect The ravener tears the creature's soul from its body with their maw and gulps it down. The dying creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Consume Soul] save with the same DC as the ravener's Breath Weapon.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The ravener tears off a small chunk of the creature's soul. If the victim is restored to life, they are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} in addition to any other side effects of returning to life. The ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to half the creature's level.

Failure As success, but the creature's soul is ravaged. The creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 3} and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to the creature's level.

Critical Failure As failure, but the ravener devours the entire soul. The victim can't be restored to life as long as the ravener exists except via a 10th-level effect such as @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, and the ravener adds a number of Hit Points to their soul ward equal to twice the creature's level.
VLCECgjkL5bNOxpx.name: (Ravener) Consume Soul

VXKiqiW7gXfFCz1U.description:
Requirements A creature is within 90 feet of the Melfesh Monster and is standing on the ground

Effect Fungal threads burst from the ground. The creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|name:Mycelial Tomb] save or inhale Melfesh spores that remain in its body for 1 minute, be encased in mycelia, and be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2}. The mycelia have Hardness 8 and 16 HP, and the DC to Force them Open is 21. Breaking the mycelia frees the creature and ends the slowed effect. If someone other than the encased creatures breaks the mycelia from the outside, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and takes any damage dealt by the breaking effect in excess of the mycelia's Hit Points. This replaces the Envelop ability.
VXKiqiW7gXfFCz1U.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
VXKiqiW7gXfFCz1U.name: (Melfish Monster) Mycelial Tomb

VzKVJlX2ocv1ezzp.description:
The visitant exhales sharply, releasing pungent fumes from its lungs in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15]{15-foot cone}.

Each creature in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Noxious Breath] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure).
VzKVJlX2ocv1ezzp.source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God
VzKVJlX2ocv1ezzp.name: (Visitant) Noxious Breath

W5fD1ebH6Ri8HNzh.description:
The graveknight can gift a piece of its armor to a willing ally, which becomes its grave squire.

The graveknight can communicate telepathically with its squire at any distance, see through the squire's senses, and cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} as a divine innate spell through the telepathic link at will; the squire treats its degree of success as one step worse.

If the graveknight's main armor is destroyed, the squire's piece expands to cover the squire's body over [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}, after which point it becomes the graveknight's new body.

The graveknight can have only one squire at a time, and must recover the gifted piece of armor if it wishes to create a new squire.
W5fD1ebH6Ri8HNzh.name: (Graveknight) Create Grave Squire

W77QhVNE46WDyMXi.description:
When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released.

Adjacent creatures take [[/r {1d6}[slashing]]]{1d6 slashing damage} per 2 levels (minimum 1d6) with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:|basic:true|name:Explosive Death] save.
W77QhVNE46WDyMXi.name: (Skeleton) Explosive Death

WQjFPBQPDu6vyJny.description:
The ghost loses the incorporeal trait, temporarily increasing its Strength modifier to equal its Charisma modifier. The ghost loses its immunity to precision damage and its resistance to all damage while corporeal.

The ghost can resume being incorporeal by using this action again.
WQjFPBQPDu6vyJny.name: (Ghost) Corporeal Manifestation

WtRxZEPH963RkUCj.description:
Requirements Kuworsys is Reared Back

Effect Kuworsys Strikes each creature within its reach, to a maximum of four Strikes (one for each available limb). It can make limb Strikes or weapon Strikes, including with ranged weapons, but can use each weapon only once. Each attack counts toward Kuworsys's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.
WtRxZEPH963RkUCj.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
WtRxZEPH963RkUCj.name: (Kuworsys) Rain Blows

X2mdpb1Dhl890YbA.description:
The worm that walks collapses into a shapeless swarm of worms. It drops all held, worn, and carried items.

While discorporated, the worm that walks can't use attack actions and can't cast spells, but it can move through areas small enough for its individual worms to fit without having to Squeeze. It can use the same action to coalesce back into its normal form.
X2mdpb1Dhl890YbA.name: (Worm That Walks) Swarm Shape

XHut4MN0JBgm7WaN.description:
Requirement A @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains HP equal to 10% of its maximum HP, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.
XHut4MN0JBgm7WaN.name: (Vampire, True) Drink Blood

XbHMVjHtbPaPr9P5.description:
The ravener treats an attack roll as a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20, as long as the attack roll was a success. Additionally, whenever the ravener makes a critical hit with one of their Strikes, the target must succeed on a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Vicious Criticals] save or gain the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} condition. If the target already has a drained value of greater than 0, their drained value instead increases by 1, to a maximum of drained 4.

Whenever the ravener applies drain to a creature in this way, their soul ward gains 5 Hit Points.
XbHMVjHtbPaPr9P5.name: (Ravener) Vicious Criticals

XvPm866TKSfclErJ.description:
A creature damaged by the lich's hand Strike must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:] save against the lich's spell DC-4.

The creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round on a failure. On a critical failure, the creature is paralyzed permanently, falls @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and seems dead. A @Check[type:medicine|dc:25|name:Diagnose Paralysis|traits:arcane,curse,necromancy|overrideTraits:true] check reveals the victim is alive.
XvPm866TKSfclErJ.name: (Lich) Paralyzing Touch

Y46uZK6X7J7iMsgq.description: Ulgrem-Axaan can mimic the sound of a wounded prey animal by attempting a Deception check to Lie. It has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.
Y46uZK6X7J7iMsgq.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
Y46uZK6X7J7iMsgq.name: (Ulgrem-Axaan) Crocodile Tears

ZIFaA4jDQjM0vq8q.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Positive Energy Plane, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.
ZIFaA4jDQjM0vq8q.name: (Graveknight) Rejuvenation

ZMTnwyXjyfy7Ryi6.description:
The vampire transforms into one of its animal forms or back into its normal form. Most vampires can turn into a bat, but some can turn into a different creature, such as a rat or a wolf.

Use the options in the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK]{Aerial Form} and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp]{Animal Form} spells as guidelines.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarm} or @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.C9s5tBxVValC2HTE]{Giant Bat}. It gains echolocation 40 feet, a land Speed of 20 feet and a fly Speed of 30 feet, and a fangs Strike with the same attack bonus as its highest melee attack. These fangs deal the same amount of damage as the vampire's claws, but deal piercing damage rather than slashing damage.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
ZMTnwyXjyfy7Ryi6.name: (Vampire, True) Change Shape

Zu6feO9NUZJlsKuc.description: The worm that walks Strides, ending its movement sharing a space with a creature, and deals piercing damage to the creature equal to [[/r {1d8}[piercing]]]{1d8 piercing} plus an additional 1d8 for every 3 levels the worm that walks has. The creature can attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:|basic:true|name:Squirming Embrace] save with a DC of the worm that walks's spell DC - 2.
Zu6feO9NUZJlsKuc.name: (Worm That Walks) Squirming Embrace

a7A4xY3NeWI2Ya4Z.description: When a lich is destroyed, its soul immediately transfers to its @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage}. A lich can be permanently destroyed only if its soul cage is found and destroyed.
a7A4xY3NeWI2Ya4Z.name: (Lich) Rejuvenation

aiwlPSmNY9b6Psvd.description: The ghost laments its fate, forcing each living creature within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} to attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:] save. On a failure, a creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} on a critical failure). On a success, a creature is temporarily immune to this ghost's frightful moan for 1 minute.
aiwlPSmNY9b6Psvd.name: (Ghost) Frightful Moan

awFTdoQfYva84HkU.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:15]{15 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Creatures entering or starting their turn in the emanation must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20|name:Befouling Odor] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to befouling odor for 1 minute.
awFTdoQfYva84HkU.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
awFTdoQfYva84HkU.name: (Ulgrem-Axaan) Befouling Odor

b3p8x6sgTa0BOvAb.description:
Trigger The lich deals damage with its hand Strike.

Effect The lich regains Hit Points equal to half the damage dealt.
b3p8x6sgTa0BOvAb.name: (Lich) Siphon Life

bTJnxBQjr7G8yr30.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

When a creature in the aura uses a positive spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+0 #Counteract]]{+x}.
bTJnxBQjr7G8yr30.name: (Graveknight) Sacrilegious Aura

bVZ6KizWVTLJUBXi.description: Any living creature hit by a ghast's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.
bVZ6KizWVTLJUBXi.name: (Ghast) Paralysis

br5Oup4USIUXQani.description: The vrykolakas moves at full Speed while @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tracking}.
br5Oup4USIUXQani.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas) Swift Tracker

c04ICnrzygyFG3PK.description:
Requirement A @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an Athletics check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains HP equal to 10% of its maximum HP, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[type:medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.
c04ICnrzygyFG3PK.name: (Vampire, Basic) Drink Blood

cYkEpJzpMu3mCrFc.description:
The ghost causes all or part of its bound site to look, sound, feel, and smell like a different kind of place, and can populate it with simple illusions of people or animals.

Typically, the ghost can recreate only a handful of images, usually different versions of its bound site as it appeared during the ghost's life. This can't disguise any creatures in the area, though it can cause minor, cosmetic changes (like causing a creature's clothing to appear nicer for a party or bloodstained for a battle).

Any creature that touches the illusion or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve it. Creatures can't leave the area of the illusion until they successfully disbelieve it.
cYkEpJzpMu3mCrFc.name: (Ghost) Phantasmagoria

d6eWuFd6pw6ffvPC.description:
Frequency once per hour

Effect The Melfesh Monster inflates with gas for 1 minute. It grows to Huge size, and its reach increases to 15 feet. It also gains 12 temporary Hit Points, resistance 5 to bludgeoning, and a +2 status bonus to damage rolls, but it's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}. When the Melfesh Monster takes damage while swollen, all creatures within 15 feet inhale spores that remain in their body for 1 minute. This ability replaces terrorspores and Spore Cloud.

@Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-effects.JlaO7fgm53Om1DxB]{Effect: Swell}
d6eWuFd6pw6ffvPC.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
d6eWuFd6pw6ffvPC.name: (Melfish Monster) Swell

eSp48kG7v1GNuGgh.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

A creature that starts its turn within the visitant's aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:|name:Vengeful Presence] save or be overcome with a thirst for vengeance.

For [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} (1 minute on a critical failure), if the affected creature was attacked within the last round (whether or not the attack hit), the creature must use at least 1 action per round to Strike or use a hostile action toward its last attacker as long as the attacker is still alive. Failure to do so deals the affected creature [[/r {1d6}[mental]]]{1d6 mental damage}, plus 1d6 for every 5 levels the visitant has.
eSp48kG7v1GNuGgh.source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God
eSp48kG7v1GNuGgh.name: (Visitant) Vengeful Presence

eXleBXdAemiEoHA8.description:
Nymph queens can transform between their original form, which looks much like a typical nymph of their kind, and any Small or Medium humanoid form, typically choosing a more humanoid-looking version of their natural form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
eXleBXdAemiEoHA8.name: (Nymph Queen) Change Shape

fTk5nmm7HHtXOdSo.description: The lich has resistance to positive equal to its level.
fTk5nmm7HHtXOdSo.name: (Lich) Dark Deliverance

fVyoHEO3fSR737M1.description:
With a touch, the ghost attempts to drain a living creature's life force. It makes a ghostly hand Strike but deals no damage on a hit.

Instead, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} for 1 day, and the ghost regains HP equal to half its own level.
fVyoHEO3fSR737M1.name: (Ghost) Draining Touch

fYDrunTldWmFvfjl.description: A ravener senses the spiritual essence of living and undead creatures within the listed range. Creatures whose material bodies are one unit with their souls, like celestials and fiends, appear brighter to this sense.
fYDrunTldWmFvfjl.name: (Ravener) Soulsense

fmUBaLklyVmNt3VD.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to move away from the graveknight

Effect The graveknight's armor animates and attempts to Grab the triggering creature. It makes an Athletics check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} using the graveknight's Athletics modifier - 2. The armor can continue to Grapple the creature normally.

Since the armor is grappling the creature, the graveknight doesn't need a free hand to do so.
fmUBaLklyVmNt3VD.name: (Graveknight) Clutching Armor

fqZhojt2M5LfSKSH.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The lich taps into its @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.NEbr7nKuiluJgBHT]{Soul Cage's} power to cast any arcane spell up to the highest level the lich can cast, even if the spell being cast is not one of the lich's prepared spells. The lich's soul cage doesn't need to be present for the lich to use this ability.
fqZhojt2M5LfSKSH.name: (Lich) Drain Soul Cage

ga0Oj7mmjSwWQgmR.description:
The ghost stares at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target takes [[/r {1d6}[negative]]]{1d6 negative damage} + 1d6 per 2 levels with a @Check[type:will|dc:]{basic Will} save.

A creature that fails its save is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.
ga0Oj7mmjSwWQgmR.name: (Ghost) Corrupting Gaze

hA6HsM4i4yPfEsDH.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 [[/r {3d8}[negative]]]{3d8 negative damage} and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 [[/r {3d8}[negative]]]{3d8 negative damage} and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VC7rtYR4hLxwg7WZ]{Ghast} the next midnight
hA6HsM4i4yPfEsDH.name: (Ghast) Ghast Fever

hEWAzlIoJg3NzA7Q.description:
Spring-Heeled Jack takes on the appearance of a Medium humanoid dressed in exquisite finery. This doesn't change his Speed or his attack and damage modifiers with his Strikes. When in this form, Spring-Heeled Jack gains a Diplomacy modifier equal to his Intimidation modifier.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
hEWAzlIoJg3NzA7Q.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
hEWAzlIoJg3NzA7Q.name: (Spring-Heeled Jack) Change Shape

haMVGGDY3mLuKy9s.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:|name:Bubonic Plague|traits:disease] (use a high DC for the vrykolakas's level)

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and fatigued (1 day)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 3}, fatigued, and takes [[/r {1d6}[persistent,bleed]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage} every [[/br {1d20} #minutes]]{1d20 minutes} (1 day)
haMVGGDY3mLuKy9s.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Bubonic Plague

i4WBOAb7CmY53doM.description: The Melfesh Monster partially controls a creature within 60 feet that has inhaled its spores. This has the effects of a command spell (@Check[type:will|dc:24|name:False Synapses] save). This ability replaces sporesight and Spore Cloud.
i4WBOAb7CmY53doM.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
i4WBOAb7CmY53doM.name: (Melfish Monster) False Synapses

i7m74TphAiFYvzPL.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Wind surrounds the ghost out to a range of 30 feet. The wind extinguishes small non-magical fires, disperses fog and mist, blows objects of light Bulk or less around, and pushes larger objects. Squares in the ghost's aura are difficult terrain and flying creatures are always considered to be moving against the wind.

The ghost can dismiss or resume the wind as an action, which has the concentrate trait.
i7m74TphAiFYvzPL.name: (Ghost) Ghost Storm

iAXHLkxuuCUOwqkN.description: A werecreature can communicate with animals of the same general kind.
iAXHLkxuuCUOwqkN.name: (Werecreature) Animal Empathy

iiIhLkjuPYJ93Upw.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:60] @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

The Melfesh Monster emits the overwhelming stink of burning, rotting matter. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the area inhales spores and must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|name:Smolderstench] save. On a failure, the creature takes [[/r {2d4}[poison]]]{2d4 poison damage} and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}; on a critical failure, the creature also takes [[/r {4}[persistent,poison]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Damage} and is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to smolderstench for 1 minute. This ability replaces terrorspores.
iiIhLkjuPYJ93Upw.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
iiIhLkjuPYJ93Upw.name: (Melfish Monster) Smolderstench

ipGBYIXk4u47Mp1D.description:
If the zombie is adjacent to a helpless or unconscious creature, or a deceased creature that died in the past hour, the zombie can feast upon its flesh to heal itself.

This restores an amount of Hit Points equal to the zombie's level. If the creature is alive, the zombie deals damage equal to its jaws, fist, or claw damage.
ipGBYIXk4u47Mp1D.name: (Zombie) Feast

iwLj14liESK5OBN8.description: The ghost attempts to possess an adjacent corporeal creature. This has the same effect as the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell, except since the ghost doesn't have a physical body, it is unaffected by that restriction of the spell.
iwLj14liESK5OBN8.name: (Ghost) Malevolent Possession

ixPqVlqLaYTB1b23.description:
Requirements The ghoul is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghoul devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r {1d6}[healing]]]{1d6 Hit Points} plus 1d6 for every 2 levels it has.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.
ixPqVlqLaYTB1b23.name: (Ghoul) Consume Flesh

jD0M3yV6gjkXafsJ.description:
When the divine warden is reduced to 0 HP, it erupts with divine energy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30], dealing [[/r {1d6}]]{1d6 damage} per level. This damage is either positive or negative, determined by the patron deity's divine font (chosen at the divine warden's creation if the deity offers a choice), and this ability gains the corresponding trait. Each creature in the area must attempt a Will save with the following outcomes.

Critical Success The creature takes half damage.

Success The creature takes full damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes temporarily cursed by the patron deity. The creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 day; this is a curse effect that uses the Will save DC as the counteract DC.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}.
jD0M3yV6gjkXafsJ.name: (Divine Warden) Divine Destruction

jTuK430yY8VgIByB.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Effect The ghost extends its presence throughout its bound site until the end of its next turn. Within this area, the ghost can extend its senses, gaining the benefits of @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.9qV49KjZujZnSp6w]{All-Around Vision}, and can make ghostly hand attacks or use special abilities originating from any part of the area.
jTuK430yY8VgIByB.name: (Ghost) Haunted House

jjWisLWwcdxsqv8o.description: While in disguise, the Kallas Devil can attempt to keep others from noticing her Loathsome Stench by attempting a Deception check to Lie. She has a +4 circumstance bonus to this check.
jjWisLWwcdxsqv8o.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
jjWisLWwcdxsqv8o.name: (Kallas Devil) Blameless

kG4fDd16fYEFvmgy.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Creatures that start their turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:0] save or suffer an effect described in the nymph queen's entry.
kG4fDd16fYEFvmgy.name: (Nymph Queen) Nymph's Beauty

kQZ6pzdSn6FaxWF2.description:
Some visitants can cast the following innate occult spells. If you give a visitant the following spells, consider removing one of its other special abilities.

Occult Innate Spells

DC varies

Spell Attack varies

1st @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear}, @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.J7Y7tl0bbdz7TcCc]{Ray of Enfeeblement}

Constant (1st) @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.QnTtGCAvdWRU4spv]{Detect Alignment (evil only)}
kQZ6pzdSn6FaxWF2.source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God
kQZ6pzdSn6FaxWF2.name: (Vistant) Visitant Spells

m6teF5ADh7vuM8Zr.description:
Requirements The ghast is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect The ghast devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r {2d6}[healing]]]{2d6 Hit Points} plus 1d6 for every 2 levels it has.

It can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.
m6teF5ADh7vuM8Zr.name: (Ghast) Consume Flesh

mEbrInCpag7YThH2.description:
The dragon takes on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change its Speed or attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]
mEbrInCpag7YThH2.name: (Dragon) Change Shape

mZpX54PgTxPta5y4.description:
The graveknight's curse extends to their shield, or the graveknight's armor uses a portion of itself to produce a shield.

The graveknight has a shield that uses the statistics of a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.f9ygr5Cjrmop8LWV]{Sturdy Shield} of a level no higher than the graveknight's level - 1.

The shield is quasi-independent of the graveknight and automatically protects the graveknight from harm. When the shield is raised, it automatically uses Shield Block to reduce the damage of the first attack against the graveknight each round without the graveknight needing to spend their reaction to do so.

The shield automatically rejuvenates with the rest of the graveknight and must be destroyed in the same manner as the graveknight's armor.
mZpX54PgTxPta5y4.name: (Graveknight) Graveknight's Shield

mwEig0MYM7EIibSU.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The barghest completes a Strike.

Effect The barghest makes a claw Strike with a shriveled third arm hanging from its torso. This attack doesn't count for the barghest's multiple attack penalty, nor does that penalty apply on the attack.
mwEig0MYM7EIibSU.name: (Greater Barghest) Mutation - Vestigial Arm Strike

nF7RKPONY5H9kEIo.description:
The ghost causes one creature within 30 feet to relive the ghost's death.

The target must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:] save or see and feel what the ghost did, taking [[/r {1d4}[persistent,mental]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Mental Damage} per 2 levels the ghost has.

All other creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to the target until the persistent damage ends.
nF7RKPONY5H9kEIo.name: (Ghost) Memento Mori

na1WJDEaoqpcQuOR.description: The Kallas Devil has a vengeful streak and has the ability to infect wells and water supplies in Riverton with sewer haze. She can infect the water supply [[/br 1d6 #Days]]{1d6 days} after the Festival of the Skinned Hooves if the ritual sacrifice of the festival isn't performed.
na1WJDEaoqpcQuOR.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
na1WJDEaoqpcQuOR.name: (Kallas Devil) Infectious Water

noOXyIXmwYN2rRd1.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.sPClc6y3dT3XZupv]{Rat Swarms}, @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.VAWmwDA08ZLQd8lW]{Bat Swarms}, and @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Oilfs8Atv2LjAsUS]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.
noOXyIXmwYN2rRd1.name: (Vampire, True) Children of the Night

oD1cA9uXYQ8evT8f.description:
Trigger The Melfesh Monster ends its movement next to or takes damage from an adjacent creature

Effect Rifts in the Melfesh Monster's body spew burning gas. The triggering creature must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|name:Vent Flames|traits:damaging-effect] save or inhale spores which remain in its body for 1 minute, take [[/r {2d6}[fire]]]{2d6 fire damage}, and become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (on a critical failure, double damage and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}). This ability replaces Reactive Growth.
oD1cA9uXYQ8evT8f.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
oD1cA9uXYQ8evT8f.name: (Melfish Monster) Vent Flames

oXRnrQQ04oi8OkDG.description:
Trigger The vrykolakas is reduced to 0 Hit Points, and an animal is within 100 feet

Effect Unlike most other undead, a vrykolakas isn't destroyed when it reaches 0 HP. Instead, it attempts to cast its spirit into an animal within 100 feet, which must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:|name:Feral Possession] save (use a high DC for the vrykolakas's level).

On a failure, the animal is possessed. This has the effects of the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession} spell, but it lasts a number of days equal to the vrykolakas's level. This possession can't be counteracted with magic (though @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OyFCwQuw8XRazsNr]{Remove Curse} works against it normally).

If the animal succeeds at its save, the vrykolakas can attempt to possess a different animal within 100 feet. If at any point an animal critically succeeds at its save or no animal is within 100 feet, the vrykolakas fails to possess anything and is destroyed.

A vrykolakas possessing an animal seeks out its burial site immediately, burying itself there. While the vrykolakas is in this state of recovery, its animal host is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, and beheading it destroys the vrykolakas and kills its host. Removing the curse destroys the vrykolakas and returns the animal to normal.

After [[/br 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}, if the vrykolakas hasn't been destroyed, the animal dies and the vrykolakas rises in a new body that's identical to its previous one, formed from the animal's remains.
oXRnrQQ04oi8OkDG.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas) Feral Possession

pEJkjqjjBXj4YjYZ.description:
Trigger A creature attempts a Strike against Kuworsys;

Effect Kuworsys blocks the triggering Strike by snapping its sling or a stolen weapon into a blocking position. Damage is dealt to Kuworsys's weapon first. If the weapon would be destroyed, excess damage is dealt to Kuworsys.
pEJkjqjjBXj4YjYZ.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
pEJkjqjjBXj4YjYZ.name: (Kuworsys) Careless Block

pxiSbjfWaKCG1xLD.description:
The graveknight died after being deeply betrayed.

Instead of being immune to a type of energy damage, it is immune to mental damage, its weapons deal [[/r {1d6}[mental]]]{1d6 additional mental damage}, and its Devastating Blast deals mental damage with a Will saving throw instead of Reflex.
pxiSbjfWaKCG1xLD.name: (Graveknight) Betrayed Revivification

qlNOqsfJH2gj7DCs.description: The Kallas Devil controls any water she touches. When the Kallas Devil is in water, she can cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.jfVCuOpzC6mUrf6f]{Hydraulic Push} as an occult innate spell at will.
qlNOqsfJH2gj7DCs.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
qlNOqsfJH2gj7DCs.name: (Kallas Devil) Waterfall Torrent

qs21GajPmFYel3pc.description: The Melfesh Monster injects a creature's corpse with spores over the course of 10 minutes, priming it to explode. These spores last 1 day, and the Melfesh Monster can only have three corpses primed at a time; if it primes another, the oldest corpse bomb deactivates harmlessly. Creatures that succeed at a @Check[type:perception|dc:21|name:Notice Corpse Bomb|traits:action:seek,action:investigate,secret] check while Seeking or Investigating notice a corpse bomb's explosive nature. Creatures can attempt to disarm a corpse bomb with a @Check[type:nature|dc:21|name:Disable Corpse Bomb (Nature)|traits:action:disable-a-device], @Check[type:survival|dc:21|name:Disable Corpse Bomb (Survival)|traits:action:disable-a-device], or @Check[type:thievery|dc:21|name:Disable Corpse Bomb (Thievery)|traits:action:disable-a-device] check to Disable a Device. A corpse bomb explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] if a creature comes within 5 feet or if the Melfesh Monster detonates it as a single action, which it can use once per round. This deals [[/r {2d8}[fire]+{2d8}[poison]]]{2d8 fire and 2d8 poison damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true|name:Corpse Bomb] save) and leaves a lingering, 10-foot-radius spore cloud. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the cloud inhales spores, which remain in its body for 1 minute. This ability replaces Spore Cloud.
qs21GajPmFYel3pc.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
qs21GajPmFYel3pc.name: (Melfish Monster) Corpse Bomb

qt2exWwQTzoObKfW.description:
@Check[type:fortitude|dc:|traits:damaging-effect]

[save effect]

The golem Strides up to its Speed, pushing back each creature whose space it moves into and damaging them if they try to stop its movement. A creature can attempt to bar the way by succeeding at a Fortitude save.
qt2exWwQTzoObKfW.name: (Golem) Inexorable March

r34QDwKiWZoVymJa.description:
harmed by [damageType] ([[/r {0d8}]]{0d8 damage}, [[/r {0d4}]]{0d4 damage} from areas or persistent damage); healed by [damageType] (area [[/r {0d4}[healing]]]{0d4 Hit Points}); slowed by [damageType]

A golem is immune to spells and magical abilities other than its own, but each type of golem is affected by a few types of magic in special ways. These exceptions are listed in shortened form in the golem's stat block, with the full rules appearing here. If an entry lists multiple types (such as "cold and water"), either type of spell can affect the golem.

  • Harmed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to take the listed amount of damage (this damage has no type) instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of magic of this type or is affected by a persistent effect of the appropriate type, it takes the damage listed in the parenthetical.
  • Healed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem makes the golem lose the slowed condition and gain HP equal to half the damage the spell would have dealt. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it gains the HP listed in the parenthetical.
  • Slowed By Any magic of this type that targets the golem causes it to be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6 rounds} instead of the usual effect. If the golem starts its turn in an area of this type of magic, it's slowed 1 for that round.
  • Vulnerable To Each golem is vulnerable to one or more specific spells, with the effects described in its stat block.
r34QDwKiWZoVymJa.name: (Golem) Golem Antimagic

s6JRMjgA7hSGUAYX.description:
@Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{5 feet} @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{Aura}

Creatures beginning their turn in the area while the vrykolakas is in its true form are exposed to bubonic plague.
s6JRMjgA7hSGUAYX.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Pestilential Aura

sAyR4uJbsWukZFZf.description:
Trigger The vampire is reduced to 0 HP.

Effect The vampire uses Turn to Mist. It can take move actions to move toward its coffin even though it's at 0 HP. While at 0 HP in this form, the vampire is unaffected by further damage.

It automatically returns to its corporeal form, unconscious, if it reaches its coffin or after 2 hours, whichever comes first.
sAyR4uJbsWukZFZf.name: (Vampire, True) Mist Escape

sECjzfaYaW68vbLV.description: A vrykolakas master can transform into a form resembling the body it had in life, with the effects of humanoid form but with unlimited duration. It loses its fangs and claw Strikes but gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Deception checks to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} in this form.
sECjzfaYaW68vbLV.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Change Shape

sajLbVE6VpCsR0Kl.description:
When the skeleton takes physical damage from a critical hit, one of its bones is pulverized into a fine powder.

All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:5] that breathe take [[/r {1d6}[persistent,poison]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Poison Damage} (plus an additional 1d6 for every 6 levels the skeleton has).
sajLbVE6VpCsR0Kl.name: (Skeleton) Bone Powder

tDfv2oEPal19NtSM.description:
The ghost creates an illusory double of a creature. The fetch functions as a 2nd-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.f8SBoXiXQjlCKqly]{Illusory Creature}, except that the ghost doesn't control the fetch, and the spell lasts for [[/r 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours} instead of needing to Sustain the Spell.

The fetch has a rudimentary intelligence and tries to imitate its original (it has a Deception skill value equal to the ghost's highest skill) but comes across as @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} or vague.

A ghost can have only one fetch at a time. If the creature doubled by the fetch encounters it, the creature must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:] save or become @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} on a critical failure) for as long as they can see the fetch.
tDfv2oEPal19NtSM.name: (Ghost) Fetch

tKixfds07IRH2nnh.description:
The presence of a vrykolakas master inspires savage creatures to crawl forth to do its bidding, including @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.sPClc6y3dT3XZupv]{Rat Swarms}, @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Sft7n3LMmnTxhhYn]{Wargs}, @Compendium[pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.bLMoqt9xqTZKnjxr]{Werewolves}, and similar creatures.

The vrykolakas master can give telepathic orders to these creatures within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.
tKixfds07IRH2nnh.name: (Vampire, Vrykolakas Master) Children of the Night

tQY2xmcIhzCM7oCC.description: The Melfesh Monster dissolves into a mass of fungal threads and surges forward. It @Compendium[pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.UNah0bxXxkcZjxO3]{Tramples} (Medium or smaller, limb, @Check[type:reflex|dc:21|basic:true|name:Trample] save), leaving a spore cloud in the squares through which it moves that last until the end of its next turn. A creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud inhales spores and must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:21|name:Torrential Advance] save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). This ability replaces Envelop and Spore Cloud.
tQY2xmcIhzCM7oCC.source: Pathfinder Lost Omens: Monsters of Myth
tQY2xmcIhzCM7oCC.name: (Melfish Monster) Torrential Advance

uV4jf2pkMRGLdhJX.description:
Anyone who meets the ghost or visits its bound site can become subject to this effect. The first time the subject sleeps after their ghostly encounter, they're targeted by a @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq]{Nightmare} spell, with the nightmares being somehow related to the ghost.

Most often this means that the subject relives the ghost's last moments alive, but there are other possibilities. If the ghost wishes, it can manipulate the dreams to send messages or even hold entire conversations with dreamers.
uV4jf2pkMRGLdhJX.name: (Ghost) Dreamwalker

unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB.description: When a ghost is destroyed, it re-forms after [[/br 2d4 #days]]{2d4 days} within the location it's bound to, fully healed.
